article_title: Bill To Keep ACA 'Small Employer' Limit Goes To President
article_text:
Bill To Keep ACA 'Small Employer' Limit Goes To President

Law360, Los Angeles (October 1, 2015, 7:11 PM ET) -- The Senate on Thursday passed a bill to block the scheduled expansion of the definition of “small employer” under the Affordable Care Act that now heads to President Barack Obama’s desk.



Lawmakers agreed to H.R. 1624, the Protecting Affordable Coverage for Employees Act, by voice vote. It was approved by the House on Monday.



The law will “protect small and medium-size businesses that provide health care to their employees,” U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., said on the Senate floor on Thursday.
